intro: Skottsbergiella colobanthoides, commonly known as the Antarctic hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in coastal areas and on rocky substrates. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including strong winds and low temperatures. Skottsbergiella colobanthoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and contributing to the biodiversity of its alpine and Antarctic habitats.
